gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Bidigare Pigments from the U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Bidigare Pigments Dataset Description: <p>Bidigare Pigments</p><p><strong>Notes on the data:</strong><br />Pigment values are concentrations in ng/L.<br />Where the value is shown as zero, this could more properly be stated as "less than limit of detection".<br />See LoD estimates below.<br /><br />Filtered volume amounts were obtained from the hand written cast sheets.<br />They are listed with these data simply for reference in case one has different values listed elsewhere.<br /><br /><strong>Station 21:</strong> No depths are listed for Station 21 because these were not available on the cast sheets.<br /><br />The response factor for DDX was used to calculate DTX values.<br /><br /><strong>Station 2:</strong>&nbsp; It is possible that some HEX is present.&nbsp; The high levels of FUCO at this station resulted in correspondingly large cis-fuco peaks, one of which eluted at the same retention time as HEX would elute if present, so HEX cannot be quantified.&nbsp; The size of the peak is about "right" for it to be due mostly or entirely to cis-fuco, but some contribution from HEX cannot be ruled out.<br /><br /><strong>Station 4, sample 2373:</strong>&nbsp; Values for this one are oddly high for its location in the profile.&nbsp; I see no obvious errors on my end.&nbsp; Possible filter in wrong cryotube?&nbsp;<br /><br /><strong>LoD Estimates:</strong><br />Volume Filtered (L)&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;1.84&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;2.00&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;3.80&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;4.00<br />LoD for chlorophylls (ng/L)&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;4.8&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;4.4&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;2.3&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;2.2<br />LoD for carotenoids (ng/L)&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;3.2&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;2.9&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;1.5&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;1.5<br /><br />These values are calculated based on LoD for MVCHLA of 0.59 ng/injection and for ZEA of 0.39 ng/injection, with an injection volume of 0.2 mL and an extract volume of 3.0 mL.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br /><strong>Pigment&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Abbreviation</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Chlorophyllide a&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;CHLIDEA&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Chlorophyll c&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;CHLC&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Peridinin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;PER&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />19'-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;BUT&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Fucoxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;FUCO&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />19'-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;HEX&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Prasinoxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;PRAS&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Violaxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;VIOL&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Diadinoxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;DDX&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Alloxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;ALLOX&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Diatoxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;DTX&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Lutein&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;LUT&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Zeaxanthin&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;ZEA&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Chlorophyll b&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;CHLB&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Alpha-carotene&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;ACAR&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Beta-carotene&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;BCAR&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Divinyl chlorphyll a&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;DVCHLA&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />Monovinyl chlorophyll a&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;MVCHLA&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />SChlorophyll a&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;TCHLA</p> Acquisition Description: <p>(tbd)</p>

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: sum of chlorophyll a like compounds
Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: expedition code assigned by the CCHDO: NODCShipCodeYearMonthDay; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: cruise section identification number; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.
PI-supplied Description: station number; General Description: consecutive station number
PI-supplied Description: cast number; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES Event Number; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date (UT as yyyymmdd)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Station Date (GMT); General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Time (UT as hh24miss)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Station Time (GMT); General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date/Time (ISO formatted) (GMT); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Station Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Station Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES Instrument Id; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Reference numbers

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES Sample Number; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Reference numbers

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: sequential sample number within a cast; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Bottle Number; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Bottle Quality Flag; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date (UT as yyyymmdd)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Bottle Date (GMT); General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Time (UT as hh24miss)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Bottle Time (GMT); General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Bottle Date/Time (ISO formatted) (GMT); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Bottle Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Bottle Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Station Number; General Description: consecutive station number

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Sample Depth; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Liters filtered; General Description: volume of water filtered; in this form generally applies to the volume of water filtered during plankton tows; however; this parameter name is also used for a variety of non plankton sampling and the units can vary, e.g. US JGOFS EqPac Bishop MULVFS sampler vol_filt is reported in liters.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of chlorophyllide-a per unit volume of the water body [particulate >GF/F phase] by filtration, acetone extraction and high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Chlorophyllide a; General Description: chlorophyllide a NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. The quoted value either results from a single determination or the average of replicate determinations.

PI-supplied Description: Chlorophyll c; General Description: sum of chlorophyll c1 + chlorophyll c2 + Mg 3,8 divinyl pheoporphyrin a5, in milligrams per meter cubed (mg/m) or micrograms per liter (g/l), or for US JGOFS units are nanograms/liter

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of peridinin per unit volume of the water body [particulate >GF/F phase] by filtration, acetone extraction and high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Peridinin; General Description: peridinin NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. The quoted value either results from a single determination or the average of replicate determinations.
PI-supplied Description: 19'-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin; General Description: 19-prime-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of fucoxanthin per unit volume of the water body [particulate >GF/F phase] by filtration, acetone extraction and high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Fucoxanthin; General Description: fucoxanthin NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. The quoted value either results from a single determination or the average of replicate determinations.
PI-supplied Description: 19'-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin; General Description: 19-prime-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Prasinoxanthin; General Description: prasinoxanthin NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Violaxanthin; General Description: violaxanthin NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of alloxanthin per unit volume of the water body [particulate >GF/F phase] by filtration, acetone extraction and high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Alloxanthin; General Description: alloxanthin NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. The quoted value either results from a single determination or the average of replicate determinations.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of diatoxanthin per unit volume of the water body [particulate >GF/F phase] by filtration, acetone extraction and high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Diatoxanthin; General Description: diatoxanthin NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Chlorophyll b; General Description: chlorophyll b pigment, in milligrams per meter cubed (mg/m) or micrograms per liter (g/l), or for US JGOFS units are nanograms/liter NERC Description: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acetone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: sum of chlorophyll a like compounds

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: sum of chlorophyll a like compounds

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: SChlorophyll a; General Description: sum of chlorophyll a like compounds; CAUTION file dependent; list of compounds making up the sum total may vary; refer to data documentation for complete definition

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing Notes</strong><br />&nbsp;- Generated from original .xlsx file "GEOTRACES_May2014_final.xlsx, sheet: Pigment data" contributed by Jim Moffett<br />&nbsp;- Station, cast, bottle and sample metadata inserted from EPZT Master_Event sheet<br />&nbsp;- Parameter names edited to conform to BCO-DMO naming convention found at <a href="http://usjgofs.whoi.edu/naming-guidelines.html" target="_blank">Choosing Parameter Name</a></p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO PI Supplied Instrument Description:CTD bottle data from 30-ODF/SIOR (Ocean Data Facility 12 bottle, 30 liter Niskin rosette) Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: CTD Sea-Bird SBE 911plus Instrument Short Name:CTD SBE 911plus Instrument Description: The Sea-Bird SBE 911plus is a type of CTD instrument package for continuous measurement of conductivity, temperature and pressure. The SBE 911plus includes the SBE 9plus Underwater Unit and the SBE 11plus Deck Unit (for real-time readout using conductive wire) for deployment from a vessel. The combination of the SBE 9plus and SBE 11plus is called a SBE 911plus. The SBE 9plus uses Sea-Bird's standard modular temperature and conductivity sensors (SBE 3plus and SBE 4). The SBE 9plus CTD can be configured with up to eight auxiliary sensors to measure other parameters including dissolved oxygen, pH, turbidity, fluorescence, light (PAR), light transmission, etc.). more information from Sea-Bird Electronics Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0058/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
